Class About

  • java.lang.Object
    • About
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class About
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Creates an about dialog that will display information about the programmers of Tetristry.
    Version:
    1.1, May 22th, 2014
    Author:
    Richard Dang

    • Method Detail

      • aboutDialog

        public void aboutDialog()
        This method creates and sets up the about dialog.The buttons and logo are read in from an image file. The logo is enlarged and made transparent.
        Parameters:
        dLabel-reference - variable for label to display text.
        logo-BufferedImage - variable for logo.
        logoLabel-reference - variable for JLabel for logo information.
        continues-BufferedImage - variable for continue button.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading image file.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Implemented abstract method that closes the dialog when the continue button is clicked, through an if statement. An if statement also checks if the user is in game, in which case the game will resume.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae-ActionEvent - variable passed in.
